title: The pmplots Gallery
text:
Source
The pmtables package is maintained here.
The code for this book is maintained here.


Build

packageVersion("pmtables")

[1] '0.4.1.9003'

date()

[1] "Mon May  2 16:48:24 2022"

title: 2  col//title specification
text:
This is a way to specify the column name for source data along with the axis label
When only the column is given, then the column name will be used for the column title:

title: 2  col//title specification
text:
2.1 Generate using the yspec package
You can also pull col//title data from a yspec object. Load the yspec package and generate an example data specification object

library(yspec)
spec <- ys_help$spec()

Typically, you’ll want to select a subset of columns and then call axis_col_labs()

spec %>% 
  ys_select(WT, AGE, BMI) %>% 
  axis_col_labs()

                WT                AGE                BMI 
 "WT//weight (kg)" "AGE//age (years)" "BMI//BMI (m2/kg)"

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text: dv_pred(df, yname = .yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text:
3.2 Observed versus population predicted - log/log

dv_pred(df, loglog=TRUE, yname = .yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text:
3.3 Observed versus individual predicted (dv_ipred)

dv_ipred(df, yname=.yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
text:
3.4 Observed versus individual predicted - log/log

dv_ipred(df, loglog=TRUE, yname = .yname)

title: 3  Observed vs predicted
section: 3.5 Observed versus both PRED and IPRED
text:
3.5 Observed versus both PRED and IPRED

dv_preds(df) %>% pm_grid(ncol=2)

title: 4  Residual plots
text: res_time(df)

title: 4  Residual plots
section: 4.2 Residuals versus time after first dose (res_tafd)
text:
4.2 Residuals versus time after first dose (res_tafd)

res_tafd(df)

title: 4  Residual plots
text:
4.3 Residuals versus time after dose (res_tad)

res_tad(df)

title: 4  Residual plots
text:
4.4 Residuals versus population predicted (res_pred)

res_pred(df)

title: 4  Residual plots
text:
4.5 RES versus continuous covariate (res_cont)

res_cont(df, x="WT//Weight (kg)")




This function is also vectorized in x.

c("WT", "CRCL", "AST") %>% map(.f = partial(res_cont,df)) %>% pm_grid()

title: 4  Residual plots
text:
4.6 RES by categorical covariate (res_cat)

dplyr::count(df, STUDYc)

# A tibble: 4 × 2
  STUDYc      n
  <fct>   <int>
1 SAD       424
2 MAD      1199
3 Renal     960
4 Hepatic   559

res_cat(df, x="STUDYc//Study type")

text:

res_hist(df)

text:

Vectorized version

[[1]]






[[2]]

title: 5  ETA plots
text:
etas <- c("ETA1//ETA-CL", "ETA2//ETA-V2", "ETA3//ETA-KA")
covs <- c("WT//Weight (kg)", "ALB//Albumin (g/dL)", "SCR//Creatinine (mg/dL)")

title: 5  ETA plots
text:
5.1 ETA versus continuous covariates (eta_cont)
Grouped by eta ::: {.cell}
eta_cont(id, x=covs,y=etas[2]) %>% pm_grid()



:::
Grouped by covariate ::: {.cell}
eta_cont(id, x=covs[1], y=etas) %>% pm_grid(ncol=2)



:::

title: 5  ETA plots
text:
5.2 ETA by categorical covariates (eta_cat)

p <- eta_cat(id, x="STUDYc//Study type", y=etas)


pm_grid(p)

title: 5  ETA plots
text:
5.3 ETA histograms (eta_hist)

etas <- c("ETA1//ETA-CL", "ETA2//ETA-V2", "ETA3//ETA-KA")
p <- eta_hist(id,etas, bins=10)


pm_grid(p)

title: 5  ETA plots
text:
5.4 ETA pairs plot (eta_pairs)

p <- eta_pairs(id, etas)


print(p)
